abstr 0.1.0
  • Reference

Generate A/B Street Scenario files/objects

Source: R/ab_scenario.R
ab_scenario.Rd

Generate A/B Street Scenario files/objects

ab_scenario(
  houses,
  buildings,
  desire_lines,
  zones,
  scenario = "base",
  time_fun = ab_time_normal,
  output_format = "sf",
  op = sf::st_intersects,
  ...
)

Arguments

houses

Polygons where trips will originate (`sf` object)
buildings

Buildings where trips will end represented as `sf` object
desire_lines

Origin-Destination data represented as `sf` objects with `LINESTRING` geometries with 2 vertices, start point and end point.
zones

Zones with IDs that match the desire lines and class `sf`
scenario

The name of the scenario, used to match column names. `"base"` by default.
time_fun

The function used to calculate departure times. `ab_time_normal()` by default.
output_format

Which output format? `"sf"` (default) or `"json_list"`?
op

The binary predicate used to assign `buildings` to `zones`. See online documentation on binary predicates for further details, e.g. [Spatial Data Science](https://keen-swartz-3146c4.netlify.app/geommanip.html)
...

Additional arguments to pass to `time_fun`

Examples

ablines = ab_scenario(
  leeds_houses,
  leeds_buildings,
  leeds_desire_lines,
  leeds_zones,
  output_format = "sf"
)
dutch = ab_scenario(
  leeds_houses,
  leeds_buildings,
  leeds_desire_lines,
  leeds_zones,
  scenario = "dutch",
  output_format = "sf"
)
plot(ablines, key.pos = 1, reset = FALSE)

plot(leeds_site_area$geometry, add = TRUE)

plot(leeds_buildings$geometry, add = TRUE)

plot(dutch, key.pos = 1, reset = FALSE)

plot(leeds_site_area$geometry, add = TRUE)

plot(leeds_buildings$geometry, add = TRUE)

dutch$departure = ab_time_normal(hr = 8, sd = 0.5, n = nrow(dutch))
ab_evening_dutch = ab_scenario(
  leeds_houses,
  leeds_buildings,
  leeds_desire_lines,
  leeds_zones,
  scenario = "dutch",
  output_format = "json_list",
  hr = 20, # representing 8 pm
  sd = 0
)

#> Linking to GEOS 3.8.1, GDAL 3.1.4, PROJ 6.3.1
f = tempfile(fileext = ".json")
ab_save(ab_evening_dutch, f)
readLines(f)[13]

#> [1] "          \"departure\": 72000,"
20 * 60^2

#> [1] 72000
